metadata.Title: CVE-2019-16056 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Python through 2.7.16, 3.x through 3.5.7, 3.6.xthrough 3.6.9, and 3.7.x through 3.7.4. The email module wrongly parsesemail addresses that contain multiple @ characters. An application thatuses the email module and implements some kind of checks on the From/Toheaders of a message could be tricked into accepting an email address thatshould be denied. An attack may be the same as in CVE-2019-11340; however,this CVE applies to Python more generally.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.9
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.9
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.9
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.9
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.9
python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.9
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.9
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.9
No subscription required

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.9
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.9
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.9
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.9
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.9
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.9
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.9
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.9
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.9').
python3.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.9').
